titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: We left Hexham at 11 a.m., & motored to Sunderland by way of Newcastle, arriving in time to look over the new Seaman's Institute before lunch. The various functions arranged by
, the Chaplain, with astonishing skill went through without hitch of any kind.

spoke excellently: & there was a considerable gathering. I was pleased to notice that the large crowd in the street removed their caps at the National Anthem, and joined in the singing. We had tea with

, who again asked me to consider the case of the old man, a retired postman, who covets ordination to a perpetual diaconate. But I refused, the precedent would be too formidable. We got back to Auckland shortly after 6.30 p.m. and found that the three American ladies,
and her two friends, had arrived in the course of the afternoon.
